name: 1,2-bis(4-aminophenyl)ethanone
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2983
Reason: 1,2-bis(4-aminophenyl)ethanone is a derivative of benzene with two amino groups and a ketone group. The melting point of benzene is 5.5°C. The presence of two amino groups increases the melting point due to hydrogen bonding and increased molecular weight. Each amino group can contribute approximately +30°C to +50°C, totaling +60°C to +100°C. The ketone group also increases the melting point due to hydrogen bonding and increased molecular weight, contributing approximately +20°C to +40°C. The overall melting point increase is estimated to be around +80°C to +140°C.
